sen.j: 梅小路蒸気機関車館（うめこうじじょうききかんしゃかん）は、京都府京都市下京区観喜寺町にある西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）が運営する蒸気機関車の鉄道保存展示施設である。
sen.e: The Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum is a preservation and display facility for steam engines, operated by West Japan Passenger Railway (JR West Japan), located in Kankiji-chou, Simogyou-ku, Kyoto.
The Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum is a preservation and display facility for steam engines, operated by West Japan Passenger Railway (JR West Japan), located in Kankiji-chou, Simogyou-ku, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Umekoji Steam Locomotive Museum is a preservation and display facility for steam locomotives, operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West Japan), located in Kankiji-cho, Shimogyo-ku, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 1972年10月10日、日本国有鉄道により日本の鉄道開業100周年を記念して京都市下京区にある梅小路機関区の扇形庫を活用して開設され、1世紀にわたり、日本の鉄道輸送を支え続けた蒸気機関車を貴重な産業文化財と位置づけ、その動態保存を目的とした日本初の施設である。
sen.e: Opened in the semicircular garage of the Umekoji engine yard in Shimogyou-ku, Kyoto, on October 10, 1972, by Japan National Railway as a memorial on the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the first railway in Japan, it was the first facility in Japan to preserve working steam locomotives, honoring them as precious artifacts of industrial culture that supported Japan's rail transport for a century.

Opened in the semicircular garage of the Umekoji engine yard in Shimogyou-ku, Kyoto, on October 10, 1972, by Japan National Railway as a memorial on the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the first railway in Japan, it was the first facility in Japan to preserve working steam locomotives, honoring them as precious artifacts of industrial culture that supported Japan's rail transport for a century.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: On October 10, 1972, the Japan National Railway opened a semicircular garage at the Umekoji engine yard in Shimogyou-ku, Kyoto in celebration of the 100th anniversary of the first railway in Japan. The first of its kind, this facility preserves working steam locomotives, honoring them as precious artifacts of industrial culture that supported the Japanese rail transport system.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 1987年の国鉄分割民営化にともなってJR西日本が引き継いだ。
sen.e: JR West Japan took over in 1987, with the breakup and privatization of National Rail.
JR West Japan took over the facility in 1987, following the breakup and privatization of National Rail.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: JR West Japan took over the facility in 1987, following the breakup and privatization of Japanese National Railways.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: また、この施設自体が、現役の車両基地（梅小路運転区）であり、蒸気機関車や嵯峨野観光鉄道所有の国鉄DE10形ディーゼル機関車の検査・修繕も行なわれている。
sen.e: Also, the facility itself is an active train yard (Umekoji Railyard), and carries out inspections and maintenance on steam locomotives and National Rail DE10 Diesel Locomotives owned by Sagano Scenic Railway.

Also, the facility itself is an active train yard (Umekoji Railyard), and carries out inspections and maintenance on steam locomotives and National Rail DE10 Diesel Locomotives owned by Sagano Scenic Railway.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The facility itself is also an active depot (Umekoji Railyard), and carries out inspections and maintenance on steam locomotives and Japanese National Railways Diesel Locomotive Class DE10 owned by Sagano Scenic Railway.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: そもそも、この施設が開設されるきっかけとなったのは、1960年代後半から急速に姿を消していった蒸気機関車の動態保存を行うためであった。
sen.e: It was for the preservation of steam locomotives, which had been disappearing rapidly since the end of the 1960s, that this facility was established.
This facility was established for the preservation of steam locomotives, which had been disappearing rapidly since the latter half of the 1960s.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: Initially, this facility was established for working preservation of steam locomotives, which had begun disappearing rapidly in the latter half of the 1960s.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 当初は首都圏に近いということで栃木県小山駅構内にあった小山機関区が保存機関区の最有力候補であったが、「日本の中央部」に立地していることと、「周辺に名所旧跡がある」という観点から、1970年に梅小路機関区（当時）が保存機関区に正式に選定された。
sen.e: Because it is close to the capital, the Koyama engine yard at Tochigi Prefecture's Koyama Station was the strongest candidate for the locomotive preservation area; but the Umekoji engine yard was chosen in 1970 for its location near the middle of Japan, and the presence of other historic spots in the area.

Because it is close to the capital, the Koyama engine yard at Tochigi Prefecture's Koyama Station was the strongest candidate for the locomotive preservation area; but the Umekoji engine yard was chosen in 1970 for its location near the middle of Japan, and the presence of other historic spots in the area.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The Koyama engine yard at Koyama Station in Tochigi Prefecture was the best candidate for the locomotive preservation area because it was close to the capital, but the Umekoji engine yard was chosen in 1970 for its central location in Japan and the presence of other historic spots in the area.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 保存対象車両は原則として現存するもっとも若番の車両（できれば1号機）を選定するよう検討を重ねられていたが、C62形2号機のように、当初は保存予定になかった車両もある。
sen.e: As a rule, cars selected for preservation are the lowest-numbered extant cars (#1 if possible), but some, such as the C62 #2, were not originally planned for preservation.

As a rule, cars selected for preservation are the lowest-numbered extant cars (#1 if possible), but the facility is displaying some cars, such as the C62 #2, that were not originally planned for preservation.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: Reviews had been made to select, in principle, lowest-numbered extant steam locomotives (#1 if possible) for preservation, but there are some steam locomotives, such as the Class C62 #2, that were not originally planned for preservation.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 施設は、旧梅小路機関区の扇形庫及び転車台を活用した『蒸気機関車展示館』と、旧二条駅舎を移築・復元した『資料展示館』からなる。
sen.e: The facilities consist of the Steam Locomotive Display Hall, which is the semicircular garage and switching platform of the old Umekoji Engine Yard, and the Educational Display Gallery, which is the old Nijou Station building, moved and rebuilt in this location.

The facilities consist of the Steam Locomotive Display Hall, which is the semicircular garage and switching platform of the old Umekoji Engine Yard, and the Educational Display Gallery, which is the old Nijou Station building, moved and rebuilt in this location.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The facilities consist of the Steam Locomotive Display Hall, taking advantage of the semicircular garage and turntable of the former Umekoji Engine Depot, and the Educational Display Gallery at the former Nijo Station building which was moved and rebuilt at this location.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 扇形庫は、1914年に建設された鉄筋コンクリート製のもので、2004年12月10日に5t電動天井クレーン（1915年完成）、引き込み線とともに国の重要文化財に指定された。
sen.e: The semicircular garage, built in 1914 and out of steel reinforced concrete, was designated a national Important Cultural asset on December 10, 2004, along with its 5ton electric ceiling crane (completed in 1915) and access rails.

The semicircular garage that was built in 1914 and made out of steel reinforced concrete was designated an Important Cultural Property on December 10, 2004, along with its 5-ton electric ceiling crane (completed in 1915) and access rails.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。重要文化財の用語を修正。
sen.e: The semicircular garage of reinforced concrete construction (built in 1914) was designated as an Important Cultural Property by the Japanese Government on December 10, 2004, along with its 5-ton electric ceiling crane (completed in 1915) and access rails.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 同じ2004年に、土木学会選奨土木遺産に選奨された。
sen.e: Also in 2004, it was chosen by the Japan Society of Civil Engineers as a Public Works Heritage site.
Also in 2004, it was chosen by the Japan Society of Civil Engineers as a Public Works Heritage site.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 2004, it was also chosen by the Japan Society of Civil Engineers as a Public Works Heritage site.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 2006年にはJR西日本より旧二条駅舎（展示館）と扇形車庫・保存されている蒸気機関車一式・点検修理の工具一式などが、鉄道記念物準鉄道記念物に指定された。
sen.e: In 2006, the old Nijou Station building (gallery) and the semicircular garage, along with the preserved steam locomotives and maintenance equipment, were designated Railway Memorial Artifacts by JR West Japan.

In 2006, the old Nijou Station building (gallery) and the semicircular garage, along with the preserved steam locomotives and maintenance equipment, were designated Railway Memorial Artifacts by JR West Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: In 2006, the former Nijo Station building (gallery) and the semicircular garage, along with the preserved steam locomotives as well as inspection and maintenance equipment, etc. were designated as Railway Memorial Objects and Railway Semi-memorial Objects by JR West Japan.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 旧二条駅舎は、1904年に京都鉄道が本社社屋を兼ねて建設した日本現存最古の木造2階建和風駅舎で、景観に配慮しながら平安神宮を模して造られた。
sen.e: The old Nijou Station building, built in 1904 by the Kyoto Railway to double as a headquarters building, is now the oldest 2-story, wooden, Japanese-style station building, and in consideration of the scenery was made to look like Heian Jingu.

The old Nijou Station building, built in 1904 by the Kyoto Railway to double as a headquarters building, is now the oldest 2-story, wooden, Japanese-style station building, and in consideration of the scenery was made to look like Heian Jingu.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The former Nijo Station building, built in 1904 by the Kyoto Railway Company to double as a headquarters building, is now the oldest 2-story, wooden, Japanese-style station building, and was modeled after Heian Jingu Shrine with harmony with the surrounding landscape in mind.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 京都鉄道は1907年に国有化され、以後National Rail、次いでJR西日本の駅舎として利用されたが、1996年の山陰本線（嵯峨野線）二条～花園駅 (京都府)間高架化にともなって駅舎としての役目を終え、1997年に本館敷地内に移築・復元して玄関口として使用、内部は昔の切符売り場などを残し、資料展示館として活用している。
sen.e: It was used as a station building by National Rail and JR West Japan after Kyoto Railway was nationalized in 1907; but its use as a station building ended in 1996 along with the elevation of the Sanin line (Sagano line) between Nijou and Hanazono Stations, and in 1997 was rebuilt on this site with ticket windows and everything to be used as an entrance and gallery.

It was used as a station building by National Rail and JR West Japan after Kyoto Railway was nationalized in 1907; but its use as a station building ended in 1996, following the elevation of the Sanin line (Sagano line) between Nijou and Hanazono Stations, and in 1997 was rebuilt on this site with original facilities including ticket windows to be used as an entrance and gallery.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: It was used as a station building by Japanese National Railways and JR West Japan after Kyoto Railway Company was nationalized in 1907; but its use as a station building ended in 1996, following the elevation of the Sanin Line (Sagano Line) between Nijo and Hanazono Stations (in Kyoto Prefecture), and in 1997 was rebuilt on this site to be used as an entrance, with its original indoor facilities such as ticket windows being used as a gallery.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 1996年4月に京都市の文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: It was designated a Cultural Asset of the City of Kyoto in April, 1996.
It was designated a Cultural Asset of the City of Kyoto in April, 1996.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: It was designated a Cultural Property of the City of Kyoto in April 1996.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 扇形庫には、大正から昭和にかけて製造された国産蒸気機関車16形式18両（開館当初は16形式17両）が収容・展示されている。
sen.e: The semicircular garage houses and displays 18 steam locomotives (originally 17) - 16 different models – all built from the Taisho to Showa periods.
The semicircular garage houses and displays 18 steam locomotives (originally 17) - 16 different models – all built from the Taisho to Showa periods.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: The semicircular garage houses and displays 18 steam locomotives (originally 17 when the facility first opened) of 16 different classes - all manufactured in Japan from the Taisho to Showa periods.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 開館当初は動態保存が原則であり、C53形45号機とC51形239号機の2両を省き15両に車籍があったが、その後保存対象車両の見直しが何度か行われ2006年現在、動態保存機は7形式7両となっている。
sen.e: At first locomotives were, as a rule, preserved in working condition, as were 15 of the original 17 – excluding C53 #45 and C51 #239 – but the objectives of preservation have been reconsidered several times since then and as of 2006, only 7 locomotives (7 different models) are preserved in working condition.

When this museum opened, there was a rule that locomotives should be preserved in working condition and 15 locomotives excluding the two cars, C53 #45 and C51 #239 were registered for operation. But, the cars to be preserved have been reconsidered several times since then and as of 2006, only 7 locomotives (7 different models) are preserved in working condition.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。車籍を訳出。
sen.e: When this museum opened, there was a rule that locomotives should be preserved in working conditions. In fact, 15 locomotives excluding the two (Class C53 #45 and Class C51 #239) were registered for operation. However, the scope of locomotives to be preserved has been reconsidered several times since then. As of 2006, 7 locomotives of 7 different classes are preserved in working conditions.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: うち、5形式5両は現在も車籍を有し、2両（C57形1号機、C56形160号機）は、山口線「やまぐち (列車)」や北陸本線「北びわこ (列車)」など、本線上での列車牽引に供されている。
sen.e: Of those, 5 have their number plates, and 2 (C57 #1 and C56 #160) are used to pull trains on main lines such as the Yamaguchi on the Yamaguchi Line or the Kita Biwako on the Hokuriku Main Line.

Of those, 5 have their number plates, and 2 (C57 #1 and C56 #160) are being used to pull trains on main lines such as the Yamaguchi on the Yamaguchi Line and the Kita Biwako on the Hokuriku Main Line.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: Of those, 5 steam locomotives of 5 different classes are still registered for operation, and 2 (Class C57 #1 and Class C56 #160) are in service to pull trains on main lines such as the Yamaguchi on the Yamaguchi Line and the Kita Biwako on the Hokuriku Main Line.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: この2両以外の動態保存機は車籍こそあるものの、全般検査を受けていないため本線上での走行はできない。
sen.e: The others, even though they are in working condition and have their number plates, have not undergone complete inspections and cannot operate on the main lines.
The others, even though they are in working condition and have their number plates, have not undergone complete inspections and cannot run on the main lines.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: The others in working conditions are registered but cannot run on the main lines because they have not undergone general inspections.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: また、館内展示用の動態保存機の牽引による「SLスチーム号」を館内の線路で運転している。
sen.e: Also, locomotives preserved in working condition for display here pull the SL Steamer on tracks on the grounds.
Also, the SL Steamer pulled by a locomotive being preserved in working condition and displayed here is running on the tracks in the museum.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: Also, the SL Steamliner - pulled by a locomotive being preserved in working conditions for display in the museum - is running on the tracks of the museum site.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: この展示運転線は、かつては車庫から北、現在大型車駐車場になっている敷地（かつて館内の休憩施設と公園があった）の北端に掛け延びていたが、旧二条駅駅舎の移築に併せ、現在の梅小路公園南端を嵯峨野線を潜り併走する形に変更された。
sen.e: This display track once stretched north from the garage to the northern edge of the grounds, where there is now a heavy equipment parking lot, but when the old Nijou Station Building was moved, it was altered to go through the southern edge of Umekoji Park and join the Sagano Line.

This display track once stretched north from the garage to the northern edge of the grounds, where there is now a heavy equipment parking lot (A rest facility and park were there before). But when the old Nijou Station Building was moved here, it was altered to go through the southern edge of Umekoji Park and join the Sagano Line.
sen.cmt: ( ）内の表現追加。自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: This display track once stretched north from the garage to the northern edge of the grounds, where there is now a parking lot for large vehicles (where a rest facility for the museum and a park were once located). In line with relocation of the former Nijo Station building, it was rearranged to go through the southern edge of Umekoji Park and under the Sagano Line tracks.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 現在も機関区としての機能を有しており営業線とも接続されている。
sen.e: Today this is still a functional engine yard, and is connected to operating rail lines.
Today this is still a functional engine yard, and is connected to operating rail lines.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Today this is still a functional engine depot, and is connected to rail lines in operation.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: さらに西日本旅客鉄道鷹取工場閉鎖後は蒸気機関車の整備も受け持っている。
sen.e: After the closing of West Japan Passenger Railway's Takatori Plant, it has also taken over maintenance of steam locomotives.
After the closing of West Japan Passenger Railway's Takatori Plant, it has also taken over maintenance of steam locomotives.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: After the closing of West Japan Railway Company's Takatori Plant, the facility has also taken over maintenance of steam locomotives.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

tit.j: 配置車両の車体に記される略号
tit.e: Code Indicated On The Locomotives On Display
tit.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.cmt: 修正なし
修正なし

sen.j: 梅小路を意味する「梅」に由来する。
sen.cmt: 修正なし
修正なし

tit.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 1976年に指定されていたC62形1号機を除く全車が、2006年、その車歴簿、保守用工具とともに準鉄道記念物に指定されている。
sen.e: Except for C62 #1, which was designated in 1976, all of the cars here, along with their logs and tools for maintenance, were designated Historical Railway Artifacts in 2006.
sen.cmt: This is a serial number. For example, #1 indicates that it was the first of its model to be built.
sen.e: All of the cars here, except for C62 #1 that was designated in 1976, and their logs and tools for maintenance were designated Historical Railway Artifacts in 2006.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: All the steam locomotives, except for Class C62 #1 that was designated in 1976, were designated as Railway Semi-memorial Objects together with its logs and maintenance tools in 2006.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 特記事項のないものは1972年に前所属機関区から転入の手続きがとられている。
sen.e: Unless otherwise noted, all cars were transferred from the previous engine yard in 1972.
Unless otherwise noted, all cars were transferred from the previous engine yard in 1972.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Unless otherwise noted, the steam locomotives were transferred from the previous engine depots in 1972.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: ◎は梅小路での保存当初から車籍なし。
sen.e: * Indicates models that did not have a number plate when brought to Umekoji for preservation.
The car that the mark * was added to did not have a number plate when they were brought to Umekoji for preservation.
sen.cmt: 内容を正確に反映するよう修正。
sen.e: Registraion of steam locomotives marked with * had been deleted when they were brought to Umekoji for preservation.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 国鉄8620形蒸気機関車 - 動態
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Japanese National Railways Steam Locomotive Class 8620 - Working
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: Manufactured in 1914 by Kisha Seizo Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
修正なし
sen.e: Transferred from the Hirosaki Transport Area.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
The removal of the number plate (which lists manufacturer, model, and serial number) indicates that the car has been retired, and is no longer approved to operate on the railway.
sen.e: Number plate was removed in 1979 (working preservation)
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
修正なし
sen.e: Japanese National Railways Steam Locomotive Class 9600
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: Manufactured in 1914 by Kawasaki Dockyard Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
小樽の表記を修正。
sen.e: Transferred from the Otaru Switch Yard.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
This means that the boiler has been preserved in working condition (i.e. the locomotive still works).
修正なし
フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
修正なし
フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 国鉄B20形蒸気機関車 - 動態
sen.e: National Rail B20 Steam Locomotive – Working
National Rail B20 Steam Locomotive – Working
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Japanese National Railways Steam Locomotive Class B20 - Working
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
自然な表現に修正。立山の表記を修正。
sen.e: Manufactured in 1946 by Tateyama Heavy Industries.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 鹿児島機関区より転入。
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Transferred from the Kagoshima Engine Depot.
sen.cmt: フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。
修正なし
フィードバックに基づき翻訳を修正しました。

sen.j: 2002年に開館30周年を記念し、動態復元。
sen.e: Restored to working condition in 2002, at the 30th anniversary of the museum
Restored to working condition in 2002, at the 30th anniversary of the museum
sen.cmt: 修正なし
sen.e: Restored to working conditions in 2002 in commemmoration of the 30th anniversary of the museum.

sen.j: 一見原形を留めているが裏側に家庭用クーラーの配管がされており室外機が並んでいる。
sen.e: At first glance it is in its original shape, but household air conditioners are installed in the back, with a row of outdoor compressor units.
At first glance it is in its original shape, but household air conditioners are installed in the back, with a row of outdoor compressor units.

sen.e: At first glance it seems to be in its original shape, but piping of household air conditioners is arranged in the back, with a row of outdoor units.

sen.j: 1994年に梅小路公園の整備とC62 1号機入館を記念、保存各機の車歴。
sen.e: As a memorial to the maintenance of Umekoji Park and the installation of C62 #1 in 1994, the logs of each preserved car.
The special edition was published as a memorial to the maintenance of Umekoji Park and the installation of C62 #1 in 1994 and carried the logs of each preserved car.
sen.cmt: 自然な表現に修正。
sen.e: The issue featured development of Umekoji Park and acceptance of C62 #1 in 1994, and carried the logs of respective steam locomotives preserved.
